reviewText: It's a nice pleasant soap opera and I love Susan Hayward and she always delivers. But the story is not much to rave about and it has a happy ending. I'm sure it brought out a few hankies from the ladies in it's day. The Fox Cinema Archive print is watchable, but not the glorious Technicolor in which it was filmed.

reviewText: I absolutely adore Susan Hayward, and she looked beautiful in this film. But then, Susan looked beautiful in every film she made.This story is a simple one... a country preacher marries a "city girl" and brings her to live with him in the hills of Georgia. A number of events occur over the next three years as people in the community become ill with an epidemic, and the preachers wife questions God and why some people die and others do not. It is the classic question of life... why does it appear as though there is injustice in the world, and why does God allow so much suffering? The movie deals aptly with those questions.Prior to watching this film, I was not familiar with William Lundigan. I think he did a great job. Wow, and what a handsome man he was!The scenery in this movie was breathtakingly beautiful!Anyway, if you like classic stories that deal with subjects like God and family, then you will enjoy this movie.

reviewText: Here is a wonderful movie that my wife and I had to throw in the trash.  The sound and picture would disrupt evry 30 seconds or so.I am sure that the seller Never checked this one before mailing.  If they did, then they were fraudulent.I later found a DVD of the same movie that was in perfect shape AND much cheaper.  It was not available when I purchased this piece of junk VHS.
summary: Highest Mountain VHS  Not lowest quality--NO QUALITY!
